questions.text: Who had Cat Grant asked on a date early in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Idris Elba.

	Cat was upset early in the episode because Idris had turned her down. She told Kara that no one had ever turned her down for a date before.

questions.text: How was Kara related to Astra?
questions.correct: Astra was her mother's twin sister.
options: Astra was her father's twin sister.
Astra was her adopted mother's cousin
Astra was her grandmother from Krypton.
questions.explanation:
Astra was her mother's twin sister.

	Astra was one of the war criminals who survived the destruction of Krypton. She and Kara had been close before her arrest, but now that they were on Earth, ended up being enemies.

questions.text: The head of the Board of Directors for CatCo was introduced. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Dirk Armstrong.

	Armstrong wanted nothing more than to oust Grant as CEO of her own company and take over full control of it. He tried to use several tactics, legal and illegal to get her to resign her position.

Non.

	Non was a Kryptonian army lieutenant. Both he and Astra were arrested for crimes against the planet.

questions.text: Cat secretly had a son who she gave up her rights to early in her career. He was revealed in this episode. What city did he live in?
questions.explanation:
Opal City.

	Opal City hadn't been mentioned prior to this episode. Kara discovered the secret when she was auditing Cat's personal finances and discovered payments to a man named Adam Foster.

questions.text: Cat Grant resigned her position as CEO of CatCo Worldwide.
questions.explanation:
False.

	She was prepared to resign, even had called the press conference to announce it when it was discovered that Dirk Armstrong had been using illegal means to spy on her.

questions.text: Who played the role of young Kara Danvers in a flashback scene?
questions.explanation:
Malina Weissman.

	Weissman made her movie debut in 2014's "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" playing a young April O'Neil. "Supergirl" was her first TV series.

questions.text: Who was the lawyer who helped Cat figure out her legal issues?
questions.explanation:
Lucy Lane.

	Lucy Lane is the sister of famous reporter Lois Lane, and the former girlfriend of James Olsen. The character was both an attorney and an officer in the US Army.

questions.text: Hank Henshaw revealed he can read minds.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Henshaw, or The Martian Manhunter, is an alien from Mars. He is the last of his race. He has several powers, including the ability to read minds, shapeshift and fly. He revealed it to Alex Danvers only though, not to the anyone else.

questions.text: Near the end of the episode, which character appeared to have figured out Kara's secret identity?
questions.explanation:
Cat Grant.

	The three incorrect answers had all known her secret identity since the pilot. Cat appeared to have figured out who Kara was. Near the end of the episode she declared her discovery and the viewers were left to the next episode to see how it would play out.
